intro: Calycomelia quadrangulata, commonly known as the quadrangular calycous, is a unique flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive quadrangular (four-sided) stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some ornamental species. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and often greenish or white in color. Calycomelia quadrangulata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
